title: GCN+ and its app to close in December 2023
content:
Cyclist
GCN+ and its app to close in December 2023

In surprising news for the cycling industry, the streaming service GCN+ and its corresponding GCN+ app will close from 19 December 2023. The decision came from GCN+’s parent company Warner Bros. Discovery to ‘consolidate its streaming services to offer more content in fewer places.’

Launched in 2021, the GCN+ app hosted a plethora of live racing and over 200 cycling videos, films and documentaries.

What happens to existing GCN+ subscribers?

A statement released by Warner Bros. Discovery Sports UK says: ‘For live coverage they enjoyed on GCN+, customers will be directed to an appropriate platform – such as discovery+, Eurosport or Eurosport Extra in European territories, and be able to sign up to those services.

‘Pro-rata refunds will be given to subscribers from December 19 onwards.’

An announcement by Warner Bros. Discovery for where those outside of Europe can enjoy live racing will come soon.

Global Cycling Network posted on its YouTube channel that the show ‘will go on’, with GCN content continuing. An FAQ page on the brand’s website lays out exactly what will happen for current subscribers.

This article will be updated with more information as we get it.
